page.title: 18Local History
page.content: The Great Fire started at 3pm 29th July 1896. It went out of control in the Rickyard of King's Farm which was opposite two thatched cottages behind the Rising Sun Inn. A telegram to Superintendant Collet of Swindon Police Force brought the Fire Brigade to Wroughton but little was achieved. Fanned by a breeze the flames quickly spread and many cottages caught fire. By 4:30 the Wooton Bassett Brigade had arrived but the problem was water and the fire continued to spread. By evening the wind had subsided and rain fell and at last the fire was put out but there was complete devastation with 100 people homeless and enormous damage. A relief fund was set up and within a week Â£200 had been collected for the homeless.
